2.text: “So my anxious thoughts compel me to answer, because of the turmoil within me.

3.text: I have heard a rebuke that insults me, and my understanding prompts a reply.

4.text: Do you not know that from antiquity, since man was placed on the earth,

5.text: the triumph of the wicked has been brief and the joy of the godless momentary?

6.text: Though his arrogance reaches the heavens, and his head touches the clouds,

7.text: he will perish forever, like his own dung; those who had seen him will ask, ‘Where is he?’

8.text: He will fly away like a dream, never to be found; he will be chased away like a vision in the night.

9.text: The eye that saw him will see him no more, and his place will no longer behold him.

10.text: His sons will seek the favor of the poor, for his own hands must return his wealth.

11.text: The youthful vigor that fills his bones will lie down with him in the dust.

12.text: Though evil is sweet in his mouth and he conceals it under his tongue,

13.text: though he cannot bear to let it go and keeps it in his mouth,

14.text: yet in his stomach his food sours into the venom of cobras within him.

15.text: He swallows wealth but vomits it out; God will force it from his stomach.

16.text: He will suck the poison of cobras; the fangs of a viper will kill him.

17.text: He will not enjoy the streams, the rivers flowing with honey and cream.

18.text: He must return the fruit of his labor without consuming it; he cannot enjoy the profits of his trading.

19.text: For he has oppressed and forsaken the poor; he has seized houses he did not build.

20.text: Because his appetite is never satisfied, he cannot escape with his treasure.

21.text: Nothing is left for him to consume; thus his prosperity will not endure.

22.text: In the midst of his plenty, he will be distressed; the full force of misery will come upon him.

23.text: When he has filled his stomach, God will vent His fury upon him, raining it down on him as he eats.

24.text: Though he flees from an iron weapon, a bronze-tipped arrow will pierce him.

25.text: It is drawn out of his back, the gleaming point from his liver. Terrors come over him.

26.text: Total darkness is reserved for his treasures. A fire unfanned will consume him and devour what is left in his tent.

27.text: The heavens will expose his iniquity, and the earth will rise up against him.

28.text: The possessions of his house will be removed, flowing away on the day of God’s wrath.

29.text: This is the wicked man’s portion from God, the inheritance God has appointed him.”
